channel.title: Best Sequel
channel.description:
Discuss what you think the best sequel to any game is. The one the made the most improvement to the origional, or just an overall awesome game.

item.title: Best Sequel
item.dc:creator: JohnKiller118
item.description:
Imonfire:

Isn’t Half-Life the prequel of Half-Life 2? Prequel as in the opposite of a sequel?

No. Half-Life is a predecessor of Half-Life 2. A Prequel would be a game that’s made after the original, but the story takes place before the original. An example would be the Star Wars films that must not be named.

item.dc:creator: ManlyStump
item.description:
Dust:

I think prequel usually refers to a game released on a later date, but is set before the previous one.

Dust is correct. Sequels, prequels, interquels, midquels, and any other variation of -quels refer to a work created afterwards, regardless of its place in the narrative timeline.

HL is a predecessor of HL2.

item.title: Best Sequel
item.dc:creator: John_Killer118
item.description:
Saints Row 2- Being a big GTA fanboy at the time, Saints Row 1 was a big surprise. It was a GTA clone that was good enough to stand on its own.
But Saints Row 2 gained the series it’s well deserved “Wow” status. It was everything I wanted from GTA4 and more. Sure, the graphics weren’t impressive, and the soundtrack isn’t as memorable, but everything else, from story to its “3rd Person Shooter w/ First-Person Controls” was sheer awesomeness!
So until R* takes Saints Row as major competition and starts adding flamethrowers, co-op, side-missions that don’t suck, and more flamethrowers (seriously, the fire effects in GTA4 was awesome! Why didn’t they have flamethrowers?!) I think Saints Row will eventually take over GTA.
But for now, we’ll have to listen to the Houser bros. “omg realism” bullshit. Until then, I’ll commit Insurance Fraud. (also, the physics in GTA4 was awesome! WTF?!)
Even Yahtzee agrees with me, and he hates pretty much everything!
https://www.escapistmagazine.com/videos/view/zero-punctuation/312-Saints-Row-2
